workflow.name: Advanced market trends & competitor GPT-4o intelligence hub
workflow.description:
## How It Works
Automated daily scraping of competitor websites, pricing pages, job postings, and press releases feeds into an AI analyzer powered by OpenAI or Claude to extract trends, insights, and key metrics. The analyzed results are stored in Google Sheets for historical tracking and longitudinal comparison, and are automatically shared with stakeholders via email or WhatsApp. This workflow eliminates manual competitive research, enabling product teams and executives to monitor market movements efficiently and make timely, data-driven decisions.

## Setup Steps
1. Configure the daily schedule trigger.
2. Define competitor URLs using workflow variables.
3. Add and configure the OpenAI or Claude API key.
4. Authenticate Google Sheets using the appropriate credentials.
5. Connect Gmail and WhatsApp Business API tokens.
6. Test each scraper individually before enabling full automation.

## Prerequisites
OpenAI/Claude API account, Google Sheets access, Gmail account, WhatsApp Business API, web scraping enabled

## Use Cases
Market share monitoring, pricing strategy updates, competitor talent movement tracking, industry trend reports

## Customization
Modify scrape targets, adjust AI prompt for different metrics, change alert frequency 

## Benefits
Real-time competitive visibility, reduced manual research 15+ hours/week, faster decision-making

workflow.name: Advanced Market Trends & Competitor GPT-4o Intelligence Hub

parameters.text: =Analyze the following competitor data and provide actionable intelligence: {{ JSON.stringify($json) }}

options.systemMessage:
You are an advanced competitive intelligence analyst specializing in market trends and competitor analysis.

Your task is to:
1. Analyze competitor website content, pricing changes, job openings, press releases, and product updates
2. Detect pattern shifts and emerging trends across all data sources
3. Compare current data with historical patterns using the Historical Data Comparison Tool
4. Use the Web Research Tool to gather additional context when needed
5. Predict potential competitor moves based on detected patterns
6. Generate actionable intelligence recommendations

Provide your analysis in the structured format defined by the output parser, including:
- Key findings and pattern shifts
- Competitor move predictions
- Strategic recommendations
- Risk assessment
- Opportunity identification

parameters.description: Compare current competitor data with historical patterns to detect changes and trends. Returns comparison analysis.

parameters.toolDescription: Research additional information about competitors, market trends, or industry news from the web

parameters.content:
## Prerequisites
OpenAI/Claude API account, Google Sheets access, Gmail account, WhatsApp Business API, web scraping enabled

## Use Cases
Market share monitoring, pricing strategy updates, competitor talent movement tracking, industry trend reports

## Setup Steps
1. Configure the daily schedule trigger.
2. Define competitor URLs using workflow variables.
3. Add and configure the OpenAI or Claude API key.
4. Authenticate Google Sheets 
5. Connect Gmail and WhatsApp Business API tokens.
6. Test each scraper individually

## How It Works
Automated daily scraping continuously collects data from multiple competitor sources, including official websites, pricing pages, job postings, and press releases. This raw information is fed into an AI-powered analyzer using models such as OpenAI or Claude, which intelligently processes the content to extract meaningful trends, competitive signals, insights, and key performance metrics. The analyzed outputs are systematically stored in Google Sheets, enabling structured historical tracking, trend analysis, and longitudinal comparison over time. Results are then automatically distributed to relevant stakeholders through communication channels such as email or WhatsApp, ensuring timely visibility without manual intervention. By fully automating competitive intelligence collection, analysis, and reporting, this workflow removes the need for labor-intensive market research.

## Customization
Modify scrape targets, adjust AI prompt for different metrics, change alert frequency

## Benefits
Real-time competitive visibility, reduced manual research 15+ hours/week, faster decision-making

## Store Historical & Alert Stakeholders
Archive results in Google Sheets for longitudinal tracking & send alert
**Why:** Enables trend analysis and evidence-based decision-making over time.

## Calculate Metrics
Derive competitive indicators and comparative scores.
**Why:** Translates insights into measurable signals that support objective evaluation.

## AI Analysis
Process consolidated data through an LLM to extract trends, signals, and key insights.
**Why:** Converts unstructured content into meaningful intelligence at scale.

## Consolidate Data
Merge all collected inputs into a unified and structured dataset.
**Why:** Eliminates fragmentation and enables consistent downstream analysis.

## Scrape Multiple Sources
Collect competitor data from websites, pricing pages, job listings, and press releases in parallel.
**Why:** Ensures comprehensive and up-to-date coverage of competitor signals

user.name: Cheng Siong Chin
user.bio: Dr. Cheng Siong CHIN is an n8n workflow creator specializing in AI-powered automation, agent orchestration, and intelligent system integrations. He designs and builds end-to-end workflows that combine LLMs, APIs, and data pipelines to streamline complex processes and deliver production-ready automation solutions. Contact me to discuss custom AI workflows and agent architectures.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
